citation.article-title: Novosphingobium panipatense sp. nov. and Novosphingobium mathurense sp. nov., from oil-contaminated soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Novosphingobium panipatense sp. nov.
Novosphingobium panipatense (pa.ni.pa.ten′se. N.L. neut. adj. panipatense pertaining to Panipat, the place of isolation of the type strain).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile, non-sporulating rods (1.5×0.6 μm).
Colonies are yellow or light yellow, smooth, circular, convex with entire margins and 1.5–2.0 mm in diameter after 3 days cultivation at 28 °C on LB.
Negative for catalase, oxidase and lecithinase and weakly positive for nitrate reductase activity.
Casein, starch, gelatin, aesculin, xanthine and Tween 20 are not hydrolysed, whereas hypoxanthine and Tween 80 are hydrolysed.

Positive for assimilation of glucose, fructose, galactose, lactose, raffinose, arabinose, maltose, mannose, acetate, sorbitol, trehalose and pyruvate; negative for assimilation of xylose, myo-inositol, mannitol, ribose, adonitol, oxalate, rhamnose, melibiose and formate.
Degradation of phenanthrene, naphthalene and anthracene is negative by the zone-forming test on plates.

Phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidyldimethylethanolamine, sphingoglycolipid, phosphatidylmonomethylethanolamine, phosphatidyldimethylethanolamine and unknown phospholipids, phosphoglycolipid, glycolipid and polar lipids are present.

The fatty acid profile contains C14 : 0, C14 : 0 2-OH, C15 : 0 2-OH, C16 : 0, C16 : 0 2-OH, iso-C16 : 0 3-OH, C17 : 0, C17 : 1ω6c, C17 : 1ω8c, C18 : 1ω7c, iso-C18 : 1 H, C18 : 0, 11-methyl C18 : 1ω7c and summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH).
The type strain is SM16T (=CCM 7472T =MTCC9019T), isolated from oil-contaminated soil.
